p: While funding deficits were considered important in all regions, lack of financial resources was ranked higher in the Transboundary Rockies than in any other region. Ontario’s Northern Boreal respondents considered lack of financial resources as relatively less important than other barriers (Fig. 3). Other types of resource deficits emerged as important in individual regions, such as “Need for greater expertise,” which ranked fourth in Arctic Alaska and “Inadequate technological resources,” which ranked sixth in Ontario’s Northern Boreal (Fig. 3).
